intro: Tylophora indica var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth tylophora, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. The plant is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, shaded environments.
